title: 'Met Epstein 3-4 times': Puri sets record straight after Rahul's charge in Lok Sabha
content: "I want to remind you that today, during the Parliament session, my name was mentioned in the context of some developments elsewhere—the Epstein files. I just want to share some information... I want to clarify that these facts are all public," Puri said at a press conference. Puri said the meetings took place before he joined the Union Cabinet in 2017 and are already in the public domain.

title: After batting collapse against USA, former coach urges India 'not to doubt' approach
content: Former coach Sanjay Bangar urged India not to overanalyze their batting struggles against the USA, emphasizing their aggressive style has yielded success. He suggested a slight moderation in approach might be needed, with experienced players like Tilak Varma, Suryakumar Yadav, and Hardik Pandya potentially stabilizing innings.

title: Google to employees: You can go for our Voluntary Exit plan, if you are not enjoying …
content: Google is offering voluntary exit packages to its global business organization staff. This move signals a strong push for employees to fully embrace the company's AI-driven future. The offer targets those who may not be aligned with the rapid transformation. This is Google's third such plan in a year, aiming to streamline its workforce.

title: Stranded! How H-1B backlogs are creating cross-border tax compliance risks for professionals
content: From a US perspective, many H-1B holders remain US Tax residents under the substantial presence test despite prolonged physical absence, particularly where the absence is involuntary and the intent to return to USA is clear.

title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: What it is, who's coming, and why it matters
content: The India AI Impact Summit 2026, scheduled for February 16-20 at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi, is the first global AI summit hosted in the Global South. Google's Sundar Pichai, OpenAI's Sam Altman, Nvidia's Jensen Huang, and Anthropic's Dario Amodei are among the confirmed attendees. The five-day programme is built around three 'Sutras'—People, Planet, Progress—and seven working groups called 'Chakras' covering AI safety, skilling, inclusion, and economic growth.

title: Missiles & stratotankers: Satellite photos reveal massive US military build-up near Iran
content: Satellite imagery analysis reveals US forces at Qatar's al-Udeid air base have mounted Patriot missiles on mobile launchers, indicating heightened security concerns amid escalating tensions with Iran. This strategic repositioning allows for rapid deployment in response to potential attacks, alongside observed increases in aircraft and military equipment across the region.

title: What happened to Abhishek Sharma on the eve of the USA fixture
content: TimesofIndia.com has learnt that on February 6, after a net session at the Wankhede Stadium, Abhishek ate something in Mumbai that caused an upset stomach. On matchday, his condition worsened, but the batter decided to carry on and play the game.

title: Half of xAI's founding team has now left Elon Musk's company; What they said on resignation posts
content: Six of xAI's twelve co-founders have departed, including key figures from its reasoning and research teams, just as the AI startup eyes an IPO and a SpaceX merger.  These exits, coupled with other researchers leaving, highlight internal pressures and missed technical milestones, raising concerns amid increased scrutiny.

title: 'Family is hopeful': Rajpal Yadav’s bail hearing tomorrow
content: Rajpal Yadav, currently jailed in a cheque-bounce case, will have his bail hearing on February 12. His manager, Goldie, confirmed industry support from Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn, and Varun Dhawan. The family hopes for his release before his niece’s February 19 wedding, as FWICE also urged members to help.

title: T20 WC: Afghanistan push SA to brink, lose by inches in second Super Over
content: South Africa secured a dramatic victory over Afghanistan in a nail-biting Super Over contest. The match required two tie-breakers after regulation time ended level. Afghanistan fought hard, with Rahmanullah Gurbaz performing exceptionally. However, South Africa ultimately prevailed, advancing to the next stage of the tournament.

title: Ellis, Zampa shine with four-fers as Australia crush Ireland by 67 runs
content: Nathan Ellis spearheaded an under-strength Australia to a dominant 67-run victory over Ireland in their T20 World Cup opener. Ellis's exceptional 4 for 12, coupled with Adam Zampa's 4 for 23, restricted Ireland to 115. Earlier, contributions from Inglis, Green, Renshaw, and Stoinis powered Australia to 182.

title: More US, Venezuelan crude to flow into India? Refiners asked to prioritize these oil grades
content: Practical constraints limit the scale at which Indian refiners can replace existing supplies with oil from the United States or Venezuela. US crude is typically light and sweet, meaning it has lower sulphur content, while many Indian refineries are configured to process medium-grade crude.

title: Bharat bandh on Feb 12: Banks, transport, offices - what will be open and what will shut
content: Over 10 trade and farmers' unions have called for a nationwide Bharat Bandh on February 12, protesting the Centre's 'anti-worker, anti-farmer and pro-corporate policies.' An estimated 30 crore workers are expected to participate, potentially impacting public banking, transport, and government sectors across over 600 districts.

title: American Youtuber mocks Hindus with cow urine slurs at event; angry Indian-Americans walk out
content: During a recent Plano City Council meeting, comedian Alex Stein caused a stir by mocking Hindu customs, specifically cow veneration along with the traditional uses of cow dung and urine. Clad in Indian garb, his satirical commentary prompted several Indian-American attendees to walk out in protest.

title: Steve Smith back in action! Australia call up veteran as Marsh misses T20 WC opener
content: Australia faces a significant setback as captain Mitchell Marsh is ruled out of their T20 World Cup opener against Ireland due to a groin injury. Travis Head will lead the team in his absence. Veteran Steve Smith has been added as cover, ready to step in if needed. This absence impacts Australia's leadership and all-round strength at the tournament's start.

title: 'He's hale & hearty': Govt opposes Wangchuk's release on health grounds
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta made the submission before a bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and PB Varale in response to the Supreme Court’s earlier query, asking the authorities to consider Wangchuk’s release on medical grounds over his deteriorating health issue. SC had earlier directed authorities to conduct Wangchuk’s medical examination by a specialised doctor and file a report before it.

title: FAA halts all flights at El Paso airport for 10 days citing ‘special security reasons’
content: The FAA has imposed a 10-day flight restriction over El Paso International Airport and parts of southern New Mexico due to "special security reasons." All flights are grounded, with the federal government warning of potential deadly force against any aircraft violating the restricted airspace. Officials expressed surprise and lack of clear information regarding the unprecedented shutdown.

title: Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn and others show support for Rajpal Yadav after he surrenders to Tihar jail
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav surrendered to Tihar jail in a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case. Following his emotional plea about financial struggles, several Bollywood personalities, including Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn, and Varun Dhawan, have stepped forward to help clear his debt. His manager expressed optimism for his release soon, with a bail hearing scheduled for tomorrow.

title: ‘We are Pak, we do things differently’: Salman Agha hails team’s bold approach
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha expressed confidence after their T20 World Cup win, stating the team's unique identity is their strength. He highlighted the improved middle-order batting and faith in their bowling attack to defend targets, even modest ones. Agha also noted the batting order's flexibility and the need for improvement in powerplay bowling.

title: 'Used Pakistan & threw us like toilet paper': Khawaja Asif's big remark on US
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif lambasted past alliances with Washington, stating Islamabad was "used like toilet paper" after serving US interests in Afghanistan. He described terrorism as "blowback" from dictators' past mistakes, lamenting Pakistan's failure to learn from history and its shifting allegiances for short-term gains. The remarks followed a deadly mosque bombing.

title: Mumbai shooting: Teen shot dead over 'love triangle', boyfriend, woman held
content: A 19-year-old woman, Shifa Sheikh, was tragically shot and killed in broad daylight in Govandi's Shivaji Nagar. Her boyfriend and another woman, reportedly infatuated with him, have been arrested. Police are investigating the motive and searching for the shooter, with no witnesses coming forward. The victim was found with critical bullet wounds to her head and neck.

title: ‘Why only bowlers?’ Ashwin defends Pakistan spinner as action debate explodes
content: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq's unique bowling action has reignited debate after a match-winning performance on Tuesday. While critics question his technique, veteran Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin defended bowlers, highlighting perceived double standards in cricket's rules compared to batting. Tariq maintains his action is natural, having been cleared by the ICC previously.

title: Bank strike on Feb 12: Will banks remain open or closed tomorrow?
content: Bank unions across India have announced a nationwide strike on February 12, protesting the government's new Labour Codes.  Customers face uncertainty as major banks warn of potential operational disruptions, though they are making arrangements for smooth functioning. Unions also advocate for improved work-life balance and a five-day work week.

title: 'May not look like it but...': Ben Stokes undergoes surgery, shares pic
content: England Test captain Ben Stokes has successfully undergone surgery for a facial injury sustained during a nets session. The all-rounder shared images of his swollen face, humorously remarking on the cricket ball's condition. This procedure follows a challenging Ashes tour and comes as his captaincy is under review.

title: Trump’s zero tariff on B'desh textiles: Should India worry?
content: Since the European Union accounts for nearly two-thirds of Bangladesh’s garment exports and already provides unconditional duty-free access, the incentive to reorganise supply chains mainly to serve the US market remains limited.

title: General Naravane book row: Delhi Police issues notice to publisher
content: Delhi Police's Special Cell has issued a notice to Penguin Random House India regarding former Army chief General M M Naravane's memoir, 'Four Stars of Destiny'. The publisher clarified the book is not yet published, a stance endorsed by Naravane, amidst a political row over its citation by Rahul Gandhi.

title: ‘SC’s gender handbook too Harvard-oriented’: CJI says Chandrachud-era primer 'very technical'
content: Chief Justice Surya Kant criticized the Supreme Court's gender stereotype handbook as overly technical and inaccessible to common people and rape survivors. He emphasized the need for practical training for High Court judges on handling sexual assault cases. The bench set aside an insensitive Allahabad High Court ruling on an attempted rape case.

title: Adolescent love cannot be criminalised in the absence of exploitation: Delhi High Court
content: The Court observed that nothing was recorded to indicate force, coercion or inducement and medical evidence did not substantiate charges of sexual assault.

title: On Camera, 2 Cousins Killed As School Bus Runs Over Scooter In Bengaluru
content: Two children died after a school bus ran over them in Bengaluru while they were travelling on a two-wheeler on Wednesday.

title: Dramatic Video Shows People Scrambling After Gunman Enters Thai School
content: Thai police shot and arrested a gunman who opened fire Wednesday at a school in southernThailand, police and other authorities said.

title: Mumbai Debuts India's First Melody Road, 'Jai Ho' Now Part Of Commute
content: Mumbai has officially unveiled India's first-ever melody road, a stretch of roadway engineered to play the iconic 'Jai Ho' tune from the film Slumdog Millionaire as vehicles pass over it at designated speeds.

title: 'Only Trump, No One Else, Claims India Won't Buy Our Oil': Russian Minister
content: US President Donald Trump is the only person who has been going around telling the world that India plans to stop buying oil from its all-weather, longtime ally Russia, the foreign minister of the transcontinental nation said.

title: Will Take Countermeasures If Greenland Militarised: Russia
content: Russia threatened to take military "countermeasures" if the West boosts its own military footprint on Greenland, Moscow's foreign minister Sergei Lavrov said Wednesday.

title: Netanyahu To Push Trump On Iran's Missile Program In 7th White House Trip
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will push Donald Trump on Wednesday to take a tougher stance in nuclear talks with Iran, after rushing to Washington to stiffen the US president's resolve.

title: Parliament Budget Session LIVE Updates | Continuing Our Push On Building Infrastructure: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Parliament Budget Session LIVE Updates, Day 11: Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi spoke in the Lok Sabha on geopolitcal conflict, artificial intelligence and a challenge to the US.

title: Reading too much into Sonam Wangchuk speeches: Top Court Questions Detention
content: The Supreme Court has questioned the grounds for detaining Ladakh activist Sonam Wangchuk under the National Security Act (NSA), saying the government was reading "too much" into his statements.

title: "Jihadis Are In Power": Taslima Nasrin Slams Yunus Regime Ahead Of Bangladesh Polls
content: On the eve of Bangladesh's elections, exiled writer Taslima Nasrin has delivered her most blistering critique in years of the country's political direction, accusing the Muhammad Yunus-led interim dispensation of empowering Islamic fundamentalists.

title: "Everything Is Ruined Now": Family Of Man Who Died In Open Manhole In Delhi
content: A resident of Sadipur Bathnaha village in Bihar's Samastipur district, Birju had been working in Delhi for the past eight months.

title: Won't Breach Limits Of Expired Nuclear Treaty If US Does Same: Russia
content: Russia will keep observing the missile and warhead limits in the New START nuclear treaty with the United States, which expired last week, as long as Washington continues to do the same, Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday.

title: Fire, Faith, Focus: Chennai Photographer's Theyyam Image Wins Global Honour
content: A striking photograph capturing the fiery intensity of Kerala's Kandanar Kelan Theyyam has earned Chennai-based photographer Ramya Sriram a major international honour.

title: How Bangladesh Elections Could Redefine Regional, Global Ties
content: Bangladesh General Election 2026: The absence of the party that once championed close India ties has left a gap, giving the Bangladesh Nationalist Party and its allies, including Jamaat-e-Islami, a chance to change the country's foreign policy.

title: Facing Labour Crunch Due To Ukraine War, Russia Turns To Indian Workers
content: A group of weary-looking Indian men carrying sports bags queued at passport control at a busy Moscow airport one recent evening after flying over 2,700 miles - and via Uzbekistan - to get work.

title: Opinion: Opinion | India's New Ambitions On Trade Must Be Paired With Domestic Reform
content: While the agreement with the United States was negotiated under duress, it is consistent with India's recent trade policy, which has shifted away from protectionism to focus on domestic support programs and trade deals. But more hard work lies ahead.

title: In A Blow To Philip Morris, India Rules Out Lifting E-Cigarette Ban: Report
content: India has ruled out relaxation of a ban on e-cigarettes that would have allowed heat-not-burn tobacco products, dealing a blow to a lengthy private lobbying campaign by Philip Morris International for New Delhi to permit such devices.

title: 'Godman' Killed 3 With Poison Laddoos In Car In Delhi, Promised Them Money
content: A self-styled godman who killed two men and a woman inside a car in Delhi Peeragarhi used a manipulative technique to carry out the crime, the police have said. He is suspected to be involved in seven more murder cases, the police said.

title: People urged to take precautions as temperatures rise
content: DMO warns of sunstroke and dehydration risks; advises limiting outdoor exposure between 11 a.m. and 3 p.m.

title: Kerala Cabinet approves women, elderly policies
content: Women’s Policy 2026 prioritises women’s safety, labour rights, and laws in tune with the changing times and also focusses on women in tribal and coastal areas

title: Finance Minister to present State Budget in A.P. Assembly on February 14
content: Agriculture Budget to be tabled on the same day; general discussion on the Budget is scheduled for February 17 and 18

title: Kerala Cabinet approves revised structure for Phase II of Kuttanad Package
content: As part of the restructuring, a new framework will be included incorporating the Central Project Processing Unit – Kuttanad Regional Development, implementation and technical committees, working groups and a Kuttanad cell

title: Bengaluru’s Major Arterial Road promises relief from traffic, but concerns at entry and exit points remain
content: MAR is set to open by March-end; it connects PRR-2 and will be named after Karnataka’s former Chief Minister S.M. Krishna

title: Legislative Assembly Budget Session: YSRCP alleges inaccuracies and falsehoods in Governor’s speech, stages walkout
content: The Governor has ignored key public concerns, it alleges; outside the Assembly, the YSRCP leaders stage protest demanding that the party be granted the principal Opposition status

title: Adani-controlled Thiruvananthapuram airport collects record ₹383 crore user fee from passengers in 2025
content: A domestic passenger using the Thiruvananthapuram airport will have to pay ₹770 for embarking and ₹330 for disembarking, while the rate is at ₹1,540 for an embarking international passenger and ₹660 for a disembarking international passenger

title: APPSC Group-I recruitment: HC orders appointment of 326 candidates to non- focal posts
content: Division Bench directs Chief Secretary to file compliance report within a week, notes prima facie that digital evaluation process was vitiated at a systemic level

title: AI cameras to record genuine attendance of MLAs during Assembly sessions in A.P.
content: Speaker Ayyanna Patrudu hints at a likely pay cut for the members who remain absent frequently in the House during sessions

title: No reduction in State’s share in tax devolution, says Finance Minister
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman counters Opposition, tells the Lok Sabha that resources that will be transferred to the States is estimated at ₹25.44 lakh crore for 2026-27

title: Suresh Gopi slams State government for sabotaging Central projects in Kerala
content: He accuses the State government of being more interested in creating a clamour for things they haven’t received rather than protecting the projects already sanctioned by the Centre in the Budget

title: Docs, paramedics undergo training in aero-medical services
content: The Fellowship in Aero-Medical Sciences (FAM) programme prepares medical professionals to deliver advanced life-saving interventions in helicopters, aircraft and hostile pre-hospital environments

title: Manipur CM visits violence-hit Jiribam
content: Yumnam Khemchand Singh interacts with internally displaced persons amid peace outreach in Manipur ethnic violence-affected district

title: One more arrested in Thiruvalla spa rape case
content: With this, the number of accused held in the case has risen to four while two more accused remain at large

title: Satheesan accuses LDF govt. of forcing people into debt trap
content: Leader of the Opposition claims that the LDF government is about to complete its tenure after pushing people into the highest ever debt trap in the history of the State

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: SIT to probe death of girl in Kerala’s Chottanikkara with alleged ‘Korean links’
content: The primary task of the SIT, according to sources, will be to establish if the ‘Korean friend’ the girl mentioned is a genuine person or not

title: Centre has initiated process to accord permanent capital status to Amaravati, says Andhra Pradesh Governor Abdul Nazeer
content: The legislation proposed to this effect is being seen as a crucial milestone in the State’s efforts to rebuild Amaravati with renewed momentum, the Governor says

title: Targeted measures vital to reverse prolonged decline in rice production in Kerala, says Performance Budget on Agriculture department
content: Document recommends tax concessions or cultivation-linked subsidies to encourage retention of paddy lands. In Kerala, area under paddy and production plummeted from 3.47 lakh ha and 7.51 lakh tonne respectively in 2000-01 to 1.76 lakh ha and 5.30 lakh tonne in 2024-25

title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet clears irrigation works worth ₹344 crore, AI Living Labs initiative
content: Takes on record SIT notes on TTD ghee adulteration, approves amendments to key Acts, land alienation for renewable energy projects and fixes ₹2,39,000 unit cost under PMAY Gramin 2.0

title: VB-G RAM G scheme aimed at job creation, rural infra growth; Opposition running negative campaign: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Claiming that ₹10 lakh crore will be spent on rural development in the next five years, the Union minister said the villages will face a "revolution of development" if the allocation is properly utilised

title: Comply with by-laws,  child panel tells CBSE, ICSE schools
content: Child rights panel directive comes on complaint that some CBSE and ICSE schools were conducting entrance coaching classes during regular school hours

title: Idukki hydel project generates 115,852.672 MU in last 50 years
content: Idukki hydroelectric project to mark a historic 50-year milestone on February 12. To coincide with the anniversary, renovation work on the original phase one generators has already been completed

title: MP presses for full-fledged Passport Seva Kendra in Mysuru
content: Says the current Post Office Passport Seva Kendra operates with limited capacity and does not offer Tatkal services; submits memorandum for PSK to External Affairs Minister citing surge in demand

title: Meghalaya illegal coal mine blast: NGT issues notice to Chief Secretary, others over miners' death
content: The green body was hearing a matter where it had taken suo-motu (on its own) cognisance of a newspaper report regarding an explosion in the unauthorised mine, purportedly caused by the use of dynamite, on February 5, 2026.

title: Supreme Court pulls up woman lawyer for language used in Facebook post, asks her to move High Court
content: "Being a lady, what sort of comments have you made about other women. Had it been a man who had written all this nonsense, we would have got him arrested here itself," a Bench of Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi said while refusing to entertain a plea of Deepa Joseph

title: Rights panel asks government to revise wildlife damage compensation within 3 months
content: The directive follows a complaint which alleges that the Forest department prevents people from using forest resources on their own properties as they wish and that wildlife-related damage is not being effectively controlled

title: Four Andhra Pradesh Ministers receive ‘threat letters’ from suspected Maoists
content: Police investigating the issue from all angles, verifying the veracity of the letters, and suspect it to be the handiwork of some pranksters

title: IT Minister Lokesh, Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan discuss strategies for A.P. Budget session
content: The meeting focussed on the coalition partners presenting a united front and ensuring smooth conduct of legislative business in the House, say sources

title: Three more declared foreigners issued expulsion orders in Assam
content: This is the second time since February 2 that the Karbi Anglong district administration has ordered people deemed non-citizens to leave India

title: Retired employees seek pension hike for seniors above 70 years
content: State JAC urges 3% increase in additional quantum, says 75,000 elderly pensioners to benefit; calls for restoration of curtailed benefits

title: Quarters for MLAs, MLCs will be inaugurated in Amaravati by April, says Legislative Assembly Speaker Ayyanna Patrudu
content: The Speaker hopes the NDA government will be able to conduct the sessions in the new iconic Legislative Assembly Complex by the end of 2028

title: 8,710 agricultural cooperative societies set up so far, 27% of target achieved: Shah tells Parliament
content: In the digital and public service domain, more than 51,000 PACS are functioning as Common Service Centres (CSCs), delivering over 300 e-services, including banking and insurance.

title: Sumedh K of ‘Su From So’ and ‘Thulasi’: Kannada indie music needs a change in approach
content: Sumedh K made a splash as a composer for the hit Kannada film ‘Su From So’, which raked in over 100 crores in 2025.

title: Bharat Bandh on February 12: What’s open, what’s closed, and full list of affected services
content: The strike, supported by organisations like the All India Trade Union Congress (AITUC) and Samyukta Kisan Morcha (SKM), aims to affect 600 districts

title: Delhi HC seeks Rani Kapur’s stand on Priya Kapur perjury plea
content: Notice issued in RK Family Trust dispute as Delhi High Court hears Priya Kapur application alleging false statements by Rani Kapur in Sunjay Kapur estate case

title: Sidhu Moosewala’s parents stage protest over delay in FIR against graft
content: “Neither are they [police] acting on my complaint, nor are they returning it. The SSP is not taking any action in the matter, if my complaint is false, the police should return it,” says Balkaur Singh

title: India must sustain momentum on Gaganyaan despite complexities: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla
content: On India–U.S. cooperation in the space sector, Mr. Shukla cited his own Axiom mission as an example of how international collaboration can advance space exploration

title: Deletion of ‘doubtful voters’ from poll rolls based on BJP complaints: Assam CM Himanta
content: Almost 1% of voters in draft list deleted in final list under Special Revision; more doubtful voters will be deleted during SIR, vows CM; citing SC order, says over 26 lakh bighas of land under encroachment

title: Vigilance probe unearths lapses in construction of Punalur-Muvattupuzha Road
content: VACB cites serious irregularities in the construction of the State highway, particularly in the 30-km Konni-Plachery stretch

title: Nothing alarming in Wangchuk's condition, can't release him on health grounds: Centre tells Supreme Court
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told a bench of justices Aravind Kumar and P.B. Varale that the grounds on which Sonam Wangchuk's detention order was passed continue, and it will not be possible to release him on health grounds

title: Vande Bharat AC chair car fares much lower than those in China, Japan, France: Vaishnaw
content: He said while the fare of the Vande Bharat AC chair car for a 300-400 kilometre journey is around ₹2.19 per kilometre, the fares in these countries range from ₹7 to ₹20 per kilometre

title: Raichur MP G. Kumar Naik flags concerns over surge in cotton import, seeks stronger policy support for domestic growers
content: G. Kumar Naik said the simultaneous fall in production and productivity indicated ‘structural stress’ in the sector, and warned that policy inconsistency was undermining domestic farmers

title: Rajya Sabha member raises concern over social media impact on mental health of adolescents
content: In recent weeks, there have been instances of young students ending their lives, apparently due to ill-effects, including loneliness and isolation, triggered by excessive use of online platforms

title: Journalist Ravi Nair convicted in Adani defamation case
content: Adani Enterprises Ltd had alleged that Ravi Nair published and disseminated a series of tweets containing false and defamatory statements intended to damage the reputation of AEL and the Adani Group

title: With eyes on trade deals and reform in global governance, Lula heads to India with 260 firms
content: The largest-ever Brazilian delegation to India marks the culmination of the highest-level engagement between the two countries over the past few years — in a challenging geopolitical scenario

title: Yates' new NFL mock draft: Predicting all 32 first-round picks -- and two QB landing spots
content: Which teams might take a quarterback? Could offensive linemen dominate the first round? Field Yates projects the top 32 picks of the 2026 NFL draft.

title: Chloe Kim shows no rust, tops halfpipe qualifying
content: Chloe Kim got the drama over early in Olympic halfpipe qualifying, nailing her first run on the way to a top finish and a spot in the final as she goes for her third straight gold medal.

title: SB LX, halftime show fall shy of ratings records
content: Seattle's 29-13 victory over New England in Super Bowl LX averaged 124.9 million viewers, while Bad Bunny's halftime show averaged 128.2 million, both falling short of setting records for most-watched U.S. broadcast and halftime show.

title: LeBron sits out Lakers' loss, ending All-NBA streak
content: The Lakers were without LeBron James, Luka Doncic and Austin Reaves for Tuesday's game against the Spurs. For James, it was his 18th missed game this season, making him ineligible for postseason awards, thus ending his 21-season All-NBA streak.

title: Quinn: QB Daniels could play more under center
content: Commanders coach Dan Quinn said the ability to unlock more from quarterback Jayden Daniels factored into the decision to change offensive coordinators after the season.

title: Montana LB Tuliaupupu granted 9th year by NCAA
content: Montana linebacker Solomon Tuliaupupu will return for the 2026 season after being granted a ninth year of eligibility by the NCAA.

title: Wemby nets 40 in 26 minutes, keen to be 'greedy'
content: Victor Wembanyama watched the fourth quarter of Tuesday's game against the Lakers from the bench, wishing he could have kept piling up statistics after scoring 40 points in only 26 minutes of what would become a 136-108 Spurs victory.

title: Woman hurt by Olympian's cheating, declaration
content: The former girlfriend of biathlon athlete Sturla Holm Laegreid said it will be "hard to forgive" him for cheating on her -- and for making a public display of it after he won an Olympic medal.

title: 🏆 2026 NFL predictions: Super Bowl, MVP, more
content: Who will win next season's Super Bowl? Who is set to be the next MVP? We asked NFL experts to make early calls on how 2026 will play out.

title: From a 6-foot-7 outfielder to a 5-foot-7 spark plug: One player to watch in spring training for all 30 MLB teams
content: From prospects with big expectations to All-Stars returning from injury, here's who we're paying attention to.

title: Wetzel: Giannis/Kalshi deal does NBA no favors
content: All this might be legal, but at some point perception defines reality, and optics overwhelm everything.

title: Olympic men's hockey preview: Everything you need to know about all 12 teams
content: The NHL is back at the Olympics! Here are the top players to know, each team's medal chances and schedule, and much more.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to the men's hockey tournament
content: Just tuning in to hockey again for the first time in a long time? Get caught up here with all the key intel.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Chloe Kim shines in debut gold on line in ice dance and more
content: On Wednesday at the Winter Olympics, Chloe Kim nailed her debut in Milano Cortina while Evan Bates and Madison Chock skate for gold in ice dance free dance.

title: Six big questions on East playoff race: Does James Harden make Cavs the favorites?
content: It's time for the push to the NBA Finals. Here's how we see the Eastern Conference and what we're watching.

title: Men's Bracketology: Who's a lock and who's on the bubble?
content: Right now, it's about looking beyond UNC's numbers and taking into account the context that has the Tar Heels as a 4-seed.

title: Women's Bracketology: Bubble trouble for the ACC?
content: The ACC and Big 12 will have a say in the field's final teams. For now, the Last Four In all hail from the ACC.

title: How WNBA's expansion Tempo are working to become 'Canada's team' and unify country
content: The Carter effect helped popularize the NBA in Canada. The Tempo hope to similarly supercharge women's basketball.

title: Myles Garrett on hand to support girlfriend Chloe Kim's Olympic gold medal chase
content: Garrett and Kim had a hilarious debate over which of them was more dominant in their respective sport.

title: How to bet the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am: Will Chris Gotterup stay hot?
content: The next stop on the PGA Tour season brings us to Pebble Beach, where looks can be deceiving as far as course difficulty goes.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Miami, TCU, Wisconsin boost résumés; Utah State is now a lock
content: Three ranked upsets lead to big moves in the ACC, Big 12 and Big Ten as the mid-majors get another lock.

title: USA vs. the World: men's college basketball edition
content: The college basketball version of the new NBA All-Star format features elite talent, including 11 freshmen.

title: Power Rankings: A big week for the top of the Big 12
content: Baylor, up five spots in our rankings, is once again atop the Big 12, with WVU, Texas Tech and TCU not far behind.

title: 10 teams, 12 quarterbacks, no great options: Sorting the lackluster NFL quarterback market
content: There are no surefire free agent QBs available this March, and the draft class has only one first-round lock. So what now for teams that might need a quarterback?

title: Super Bowl runner-up rings: What NFL players really think
content: Some conference championship rings fetch big bucks. Others wind up collecting dust on a closet shelf. Players share mixed opinions on the NFL's sparkly consolation prize.

title: Can Lookman revive Atlético ... and upset Barça in the process?

title: Naumov dedicates Olympic debut to late parents
content: U.S. figure skater Maxim Naumov carried the memory of his late parents with him to the Olympics on Tuesday night, delivering an emotional, heartfelt short program at the Milan Cortina Games that fulfilled a dream they had long shared together.

title: NASCAR descends on Daytona eager to move on from turbulent offseason, get back to racing

title: Tottenham sack Frank after 8 months in charge

title: 'Everyone's to blame. Nobody won': Inside the messy Kuminga-Warriors divorce

title: Erin Jackson and Brittany Bowe's bond brings them back to the Olympics

title: Bangladesh's moment of reckoning: Why India, Pak & China are closely watching Dhaka polls
